member.name: F:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3State.Authorization

member.summary: Quit command was sent to server indicating deleted messages should be removed.

member.name: T:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client

member.summary: Connects this instance and properly sets the client stream to Use Ssl if it is specified.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.SetClientStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Sets the client stream. If UseSsl true then wrap the client's NetworkStream in an SslStream, if UseSsl false then set the client stream to the NetworkStream

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.Authenticate
member.summary: Authenticates this instance.
member.remarks: A successful execution of this method will result in a Current State of Transaction. Unsuccessful USER or PASS commands can be reattempted by resetting the Username or Password properties and re-execution of the methods.
member.exception: If the Pop3Server is unable to be connected. If the User command is unable to be successfully executed. If the Pass command is unable to be successfully executed.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.Noop
member.summary: Executes the POP3 NOOP command.
member.exception: If the NOOP command was unable to be executed successfully.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.Rset
member.summary: Executes the POP3 RSET command.
member.exception: If the RSET command was unable to be executed successfully.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.Stat
member.summary: Executes the POP3 STAT command.
member.returns: A Stat object containing the results of STAT command.
member.exception: If the STAT command was unable to be executed successfully.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.List
member.summary: Executes the POP3 List command.
member.returns: A generic List of Pop3Items containing the results of the LIST command.
member.exception: If the LIST command was unable to be executed successfully.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.List(System.Int32)
member.summary: Lists the specified message.
member.returns: A Pop3ListItem for the requested Pop3Item.
member.exception: If the LIST command was unable to be executed successfully for the provided message id.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.RetrMimeEntity(ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3ListItem)
member.summary: Retrs the specified message.
member.returns: A MimeEntity for the requested Pop3 Mail Item.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.RetrMailMessageEx(ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3ListItem)
member.summary: Retrs the mail message ex.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.Quit
member.summary: Executes the Pop3 QUIT command.
member.exception: If the quit command returns a -ERR server message.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.Pop3Client.ExecuteCommand``2(``1)
member.summary: Provides a common way to execute all commands. This method validates the connection, traces the command and finally validates the response message for a -ERR response.
member.returns: The Pop3Response for the provided command
member.exception: If the HostMessage does not start with '+OK'.
If the client is no longer connected.

member.summary: Performs the connect to a Pop3 server and returns a Pop3 response indicating the attempt to connect results and the network stream to use for all subsequent Pop3 Commands.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.Mail.ConnectCommand.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Even though a network stream is provided to the base constructor the stream does not already exist so we have to send in a dummy stream until the actual connect has taken place. Then we'll reset network stream to the stream made available by the TcpClient.GetStream() to read the data returned after a connect.

member.name: M:ArachNGIN.Net.MIME.MimeReader.GetTransferEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the transfer encoding.
member.remarks: The transfer encoding determination follows the same rules as Peter Huber's article w/ the exception of not throwing exceptions when binary is provided as a transferEncoding. Instead it is left to the calling code to check for binary.
